*div1 type="summary"* *p*Henry Austin to Austin, October 20, 1826. Experiences in Mexico. Questions concerning trade with Texas. Demand for live oak.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="10-20-1826">20 Oct 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*My dear sir*/p*
*p*There is so little intercourse between your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and this that it is almost as difficult to communicate with you as tho you were in the *location_mentioned*moon*/location_mentioned*—I accidentally heard by a *person_mentioned*gentlemen */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned* who had been at your *location_mentioned*settlement */location_mentioned*that you were still alive and progressing well with your *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*altho published dead several times not only in our *location_mentioned*papers */location_mentioned*but also in the *location_mentioned*Mexican Sol*/location_mentioned* with an Obituary notice*/p*
*p*I have been myself nearly two years in *location_mentioned*Alvarado, Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned* and *location_mentioned*Nacotalpam*/location_mentioned*—in the latter place I established a *location_mentioned*Cotton Gining Mill and press*/location_mentioned* for cleaning Cotton at the place of growth and thereby relieving the *person_mentioned*manufacturers */person_mentioned*of the tripple expence of Carriage to *location_mentioned*puebla*/location_mentioned*—but the *person_mentioned*Mexican Manufacturers*/person_mentioned* would not spin cotton cleaned by machinery and the price for exportation would not pay which compelled me to abandon the experiment with a loss of 4000$ in a year and one half hard labor*/p*
*p*I observed at *location_mentioned*Nacotalpam */location_mentioned*that the *location_mentioned*low land*/location_mentioned* abounded with live Oak but the high price of labour and the difficultys thrown in the way of all operations attempted by *person_mentioned*strangers */person_mentioned*will not permit the cutting of it for exportation with advantage*/p*
*p*This timber is now in request here and should the genuine live Oak be plenty *location_mentioned*on the banks of the rivers in your neighbourhood*/location_mentioned* advantage might be drawn from it unless the *person_mentioned*Govt */person_mentioned*should interpose some impediment to its exportation Will you do me the favor to inform me whether it is to be had in your *location_mentioned*quarter*/location_mentioned*, if so the quantity and size, the facilitys in obtaining it—the probable cost —whether *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*could be had there to cut it or must [it] be brought out—the duties and impositions which might be incurred etc*/p*
*p*The present mode of obtaining it in *location_mentioned*florida */location_mentioned*is to send out strong *person_mentioned*parties */person_mentioned*with small vessels to transport it to the shipping place then purchase the privilege of cutting and do the work *person_mentioned*themselves*/person_mentioned*—- The *person_mentioned*Mexicans */person_mentioned*of the *location_mentioned*bajos of Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned* do not value this timber and appear to be ignorant of its durability—Care must be taken to distinguish between the Genuine live Oak and the bastard live Oak which is much like it but will not last—There are no doubt *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*with you perfectly well acquainted with it—*/p*
*p*Should there be any opening for profitable operations of any sort in your *location_mentioned*quarter */location_mentioned*you will oblige me by giving the needful information I am now doing nothing—business of every kind is extremely dull and as I am poor with a large *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*to support I am perforce ready to embark in any operation which offers reasonable advantages and with fair prospects of success there will be no difficulty in raising sufficient capital*/p*
*p*Cotton has revived a little in *location_mentioned*England */location_mentioned*by the last advices but will probably continue low through the year—Hides and pork and beef if to be had at your *location_mentioned*place */location_mentioned*might turn to acct as also bacon cured in the *person_mentioned*Mexican */person_mentioned*manner for the *location_mentioned*Havana */location_mentioned*market—The Black beans of *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*called frijoles if raised in quantity would be an excellent article of export*/p*—
*p*If there is any regular mode of communicating with the *location_mentioned*U S*/location_mentioned* your *location_mentioned*place */location_mentioned*please inform me of it, as we shall always be happy to hear of your welfare and to acquaint you with ours My younger brother *person_mentioned*John P*/person_mentioned* is established here as a *person_mentioned*commission Mercht*/person_mentioned* under the firm of *person_mentioned*Austin and Tailer*/person_mentioned* their correspondent in *location_mentioned*Orleans */location_mentioned*is *person_mentioned*Saml. T. Coit*/person_mentioned* who will forward any letters sent to him*/p*
*p*Cordially and Sincerely your friend and *person_mentioned*kinsman*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Henry Austin*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*I took the liberty of braking the seal of this letter and was agreeably surprised.*/p*
*p*Yr *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned* ______ *person_mentioned*J E B Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
